In the second step, some CaH 2âˆ’ x Cl
x was detected. No information regarding possible re-hydrogenation was found. The crystal structure of LiCa(AlH 4) 3 was experimentally determined as the space group P6 3/m ( Table 17 and Figure 25) [ 292]. Theoretical research confirmed this symmetry and contributed to determining the hydrogen atomic positions ( Table 17) [ 293]. The complete crystal structure of LiCaAlH 6 was predicted from the theoretical calculations [ 294].
